title: Secure Connection Failed when accessing Microsoft Sharepoint
content:
Hello Firefox community. I'm trying to switch over to Firefox from Chrome but I'm encountering issues when it comes to getting Sharepoint from MS Office 365 to work on Firefox. Word, Exel, Outlook, Teams, and One Drive work fine. When it comes to Sharepoint, Firefox gives me a Secure Connection Failed message. Sharepoint works fine on Chrome, Safari, and Edge. Is there a setting I need to change on the Firefox browser that allows me to use Sharepoint cloud without it telling me?

Thanks in advance for all advice and assistance.
creator: MrActionscript

title: Can someone add my keyboard addon to the list of keyboardss/dictionaries (nobody has responded on Discourse?)?
content: Hi, so I have asked this question before and I was told to ask on Mozilla Discourse but nobody has responded and I asked a week ago. So, I have created a keyboard for Firefox, the Bislama Dictionary for Firefox. I was wondering if someone could add it to the list of dictionaries. The local name for Bislama is just Bislama. Again, nobody on Discourse answered and it hasn't been added yet either. Could someone please add it? It would be helpful if it was done soon. Thanks.

title: profiles disappeared after update
content: After recent Firefox update all of our profiles have disappeared. (And all our bookmarks and passwords, too!) At the about:profiles page, the only profile showing is the one I created to be able to launch Firefox. Under "Users" ..... "App Data", there are 3 profiles: the new one just created, another profile with same name and the Default profile. Can not access either of the old profiles. Both old profiles have last changed date the same as Firefox update. I hope there is a fix for this. This is almost as bad as the entire computer crashing.
creator: lorio56701

title: https://yandex.ru/internet
content: The speed of measurement of the Internet has become strongly underestimated and incorrect on the page https://yandex.ru/internet. Previously, everything was fine. Also reduced the download speed. On other browsers, the testimony is correct.
creator: sfinks64

title: Can't copy/paste images into Facebook comments
content:
I emptied cache & then reset FIREFOX (lost all add-ons) and still cannot paste images into comments on Facebook. The cursor blinks and nothing happens. Size, format, of image doesn't matter.

I can paste into status & every other computer application. (Twitter, Word, all others)

FB will accept paste of text & links in comments but not images unless saved to computer first.

I can paste from my screen grab application (PicPick which is excellent & better than the WIN 10 snip n sketch)

I can paste images in comments in MS Edge but I don't like using that browser as it does not have as many good add-ons.
creator: JoliePrincesskatana
